Author: nickb
Title: Dutch parliament mandates open source  (ODF in 2008)

Author: rob
Content: Yeah, he just slipped through the cracks!

Author: edw519
Content: Even if they don't, I wouldn't lose sleep about your code being perfect.  As long as you can have an intelligent conversation about it (you ARE passionate about it, aren't you?), you'll be fine.  Best wishes.

Author: mechanical_fish
Content:
Am I wrong in thinking that this is the first ever sighting of something like "porn for girls by girls" on the front page of news.yc? That's not the kind of thing that normally escapes my peripheral vision. But I guess I don't come here every day.

I would wait for at least the third occurrence before concluding that the sky is falling.

My vote is for a "Kill This Regexp" feature. You type in a regexp, like /xkcd/i or /[cC]oding\s[hH]orror/ or /[rR]on\s[pP]aul(?!\s[sS]ucks)/, and from then on any submission with a matching author or title vanishes from your view, as if it never was. Then we can tell the people who hate one or another class of submission to go buy Jeffrey Friedl's book and fix the problem for themselves.

Author: Zak
Content:
You lost a few points by using PHP.

You'll have a lot better luck finding people if you talk a little bit about yourself and what you're up to. Keeping your idea secret is less valuable than you think, while the value of finding a good cofounder is beyond measure. Good luck!

Author: dcurtis
Content:
My point is that it has like 95% fewer quirks than IE6. And I was referring to it as a developer.

It still is hideous. Why did they take they file/edit menus off? That was probably the worst user interface mistake in the history of Microsoft, only to be superseded by the Office 2007 interface.
